greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n that have the form a+a+b+c where a,b,c are distinct.
comment: Also the number of integer partitions of n - 4 of the form a+b, a+a+b, or a+a+b+c, ignoring ordering. A bijection can be constructed from the partitions described in the name by subtracting one from all parts and deleting zeros. These are also partitions with adjusted frequency depth (A323014, A325280) equal to their length plus one, and their Heinz numbers are given by A325281. For example, the a(7) = 1 through a(13) = 11 partitions are:
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (0,1,1,1,-1,-1,-1,0,1)
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=3} Sum_{j=2..k-1} Sum_{m=1..j-1} x^(m+j+k)*(x^m +x^j +x^k). - _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 05 2007
a(n) = binomial(floor((n-1)/2),2) - floor((n-1)/3) - floor((n-1)/4) + floor(n/4). - _Mircea Merca_, Nov 23 2013
example: The a(7) = 1 through a(13) = 11 partitions of the form a+a+b+c are the following. The Heinz numbers of these partitions are given by A085987.
maple: isA127002 := proc(p) local s; if nops(p) = 4 then s := convert(p,set) ; if nops(s) = 3 then RETURN(1) ; else RETURN(0) ; fi ; else RETURN(0) ; fi ; end:
A127002 := proc(n) local part,res,p; part := combinat[partition](n) ; res := 0 ; for p from 1 to nops(part) do res := res+isA127002(op(p,part)) ; od ; RETURN(res) ; end:
for n from 1 to 200 do print(A127002(n)) ; od ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 07 2007
program: (MAGMA) R<x>:=PowerSeriesRing(Integers(), 70); [0,0,0,0,0,0] cat Coefficients(R!( x^7*(1+2*x+3*x^2)/((1-x^2)*(1-x^3)*(1-x^4)) )); // _G. C. Greubel_, May 30 2019
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jan 01 2007
